solution.text:
As the circle circumscribes the hexagon, the sides of the hexagon are chords of the circle
If we consider the chord AB and join A and B to O we get a triangle
We know angle subtended by any side of a hexagon at it's centre is \(60^\circ\)
Also, in \(\bigtriangleup\)OAB , OA=OB=radius
\(\Rightarrow \angle OAB=\angle OBA \,and\, as \angle AOB=60^\circ\)
\(\Rightarrow \angle OAB=\angle OBA=60^\circ\Rightarrow \bigtriangleup AOB\, is\,an\,equilateral\,triangle \)
\(\Rightarrow AB=OA=OB=radius=_{j}_\)
The area hanging off the table= 6\(\times \)area of the segment formed by the chord AB
Area of the segment = area of the sector(ACB) - area of the \(\bigtriangleup \) AOB
Now area of the sector =\(\pi \times r^2 \times \frac {60}{360}\)
Now area of the sector =\(_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*1/6,2)}}_\)
To find the area of \(\bigtriangleup\) AOB, we draw a perpendicular on OD
We know that OA=OB and \(\angle \) ODB=\(\angle \) ODA=\(90^\circ\) so \(\bigtriangleup \) AOD \(\cong \) \(\bigtriangleup \) BOD
\(\Rightarrow BD=AD=\frac {AB}2=_{{Decimal('0.5')*j}}_\)
In right angle triangle(AOD) we have cos\(30^\circ=\frac {OD}r\Rightarrow OD=_{{Decimal('0.866')*j}}_\)
area of the \(\bigtriangleup OAD = \frac 12 \times AD \times OD=_{{(Decimal('0.5')*j*Decimal('0.866')*j)}}_\)
area of the segment _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*1/6-(Decimal('0.5')*j*Decimal('0.866')*j),2)}}_
The area hanging off the table= 6\(\times \)area of the segment= _{{trunc((pi_val*j*j*1/6-(Decimal('0.5')*j*Decimal('0.866')*j))*6,2)}}_

A table is in the shape of a hexagon as shown in the figure.
If it's table cloth is in the shape of a circle of radius _{j}_ cm that circumscribes the table.
Find the area of the cloth hanging off the table.
